title: Dr. Dafydd's Personnel File
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:immrama]]

[[>]]
[[module Rate]]
[[/>]]
[[include :scp-wiki:component:author-label-source start=-- |name=ArthCymro]]
**[https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/dr-dafydd-s-personnel-file More by this Author]**
[[include :scp-wiki:component:author-label-source end=--]]

[[=]]
###304529|//What we were, our former names
We aren't quite sure from where we came.//##
- **Gregory J. Holgate**
[[/=]]

**Name:** Dr. Zachary Taliesin Dafydd

**Security Clearance Level:** 3

**Department:** Department of Anomalous Humanoid Psychology, //Formerly Department of Oneirology Studies, Formerly Psionics Division//

**Occupation:** Psychoanalysis, Psychiatrist, Oneirologist, Field Researcher

**Location:** Site-12, //Formerly Site-59//

**Profile:** A steel hand in a cotton glove and an example of the benefits of the Dartmoor Agreement, Dr. Dafydd is one of the Foundation's greatest assets in anomalous behaviour management and has made significant improvements, resulting in personnel-anomaly cooperation reaching an all-time high in a number of sites. Stationed at Site-12, the good doctor is usually seen either drinking rum-spiked tea, studying the latest papers on oneiric therapy, monitoring SCPs' behaviour, or drawing crude pictures of Sidhe in painful positions. **###304529|Addressing the Sidhe or related topics around Dr. Dafydd is not recommended.##**

A number of rumours surround Dr. Dafydd. These include his past with the Serpent's Hand, his ability to speak ###6A5EFF|**Indigo**##[[footnote]] A psionic implantation technique, applied using auditory command. When exposed, the psycho-astral and peripheral nervous systems within an organism will be forced to carry out the conditions of the order. The technique gets its name from the coloured grapheme synesthesia the individual experiences when they are exposed to the implantation. [[/footnote]], his affair with the Mayor of Three Portland and his grand collection of stuffed toys, his favourite being a rabbit called Blackberry. The one rumour that is circulated the most, however, is the origin of his theriomorphism. Many a time has Dr. Dafydd been asked the reason for his rabbit form and many a time has he provided a possible answer. The most popular answer being, "I really like carrots", followed by a twitch of the nose.

@@ @@
[[tabview]]
[[tab SCPs]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6879 SCP-6879]: **Mr. Kaboom**
[[module ListPages name="scp-6879"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Whilst at Site-██, SCP-6879 continued to behave erratically. On top of sleep deprivation, they also began talking in their sleep, resumed thumb sucking and showed signs of isolation and dissociation.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
This wasn't my first SCP idea. I went through about 10 before I finally succeed with this one. Originally, it was supposed to focus solely on 6879 and the Lighthouse. However, as I wrote, I listen to the following [*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3IGrj7g0fA song]. This made me rethink my approach and shift focus. One which showed us that Dr. Wondertainment wasn't the all-loving, toymaker we all believe him/her/them/it to be. I also wanted the Foundation to be the good guys for once. It is nice to have a story once in a while with a happy ending.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6475 SCP-6475]: **Playtime's Over, Charlie**
[[module ListPages name="scp-6475"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Siwan Caradog was impacted more than any other specialist and suffered from a nervous breakdown a few days later. Caradog was given two weeks of immediate leave in order to recover.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
This only took me about a month to develop. As this was my second go, I was able to write and format it much faster. I got the idea after reading [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6999 SCP-6999] and the [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/welcome-to-spectral-affairs Spectral Affairs] article, a result of departmentcon2022. As a Sandman fan, I've always liked works where death is depicted as sad, but not depressive. I wanted to do my own spin on that.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6916 SCP-6916]: **Hiraeth and the Land of My Fathers**
[[module ListPages name="scp-6916"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Subject finds themselves walking along a beach during a thunderstorm. The beach's composition and size vary but the presents of the storm is consistent. In the background, the faint sound of bells can be heard.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
If it's not obvious, I am Welsh. 

A proud Welshman. Reading a lot of [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/from-120-s-archives-hub F120] and [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/war-on-all-fronts-hub All Fronts], I saw a lot of stuff involving Irish and semi-Celtic mythology and I wanted to do something like that. One of the most important stories of Welsh heritage, and a favourite of mine, are the tales of the Mabinogi, a four-part story that involves magical afterlives, proud kings and monsters like giants, fairies and dragons. Some scholars believe that prior to Britain's Christianisation, the characters in the stories were considered gods.

Mixed with a sense of pride and admiration, I decided to try and write something both close to my heritage and something that could provide influential material to the wiki. Who knows, maybe I'll continue this story in the future.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6505 SCP-6505]: **The Church Grims**
[[module ListPages name="scp-6505"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> On 09/05/1999, an SCP-6505 event was activated in the St Illtyd's Church's graveyard in Bro Morgannwg, Wales. The activator, Cadi Iolo, was visiting her father's grave at the time.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
This took some time. Not only because it was over Christmas but also because I struggled with writing in a style found from another period. Luckily, I had help from a very capable writer. This came to me after looking into [*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-023 SCP-023] and how the UK appears to be obsessed with ghost doggies. Not all of them are the ooky spooky Hound of the Baskerville kind of dogs but the all do share the death omen air and black coat so I decided to try and tie things together.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-6796 SCP-6796]: **Come away, O human child…**
[[module ListPages name="scp-6796"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Personnel attempted to detain Mr. Quince but were unsuccessful, with many of the personnel being killed in the brawl. Mr. Quince then breached containment and managed to escape Site-24, killing 2 and injuring 6 members of personnel while escaping.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
My first contest entry ever, this was done for [[[goblincon|Goblin Con]]] for the 6467 entry (Fantasy Goblin). I wanted to do something a little different than what was obvious, and I took inspiration from the myth of the changelings. I had also just finished DC vs. Vampires and Torchwood, so I also took inspiration from the concept of sleeper agents. Adding in some 4000 lore and I was done. Am I proud of it? A little. In hindsight, I think I could've done better.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]
[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7669 SCP-][*http://scp-int.wikidot.com/scp-7669 7669]: **It's Hard to Comprehend**
[[module ListPages name="scp-7669"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> As expected, D-7787 could not remember what had occurred during the experiment but made several requests to witness SCP-7669 again. All requests were denied. D-7787's [DATA EXPUNGED] was removed from the SCP-7669 instance by personnel with Class-3 Memetic Resistance training.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
My tied winning entry for [[[http://scp-int.wikidot.com/lorecon2023|The Mighty Lore and Aesthetics Contest]]], where I was given the Constraints of Abstract and Caldeira. This is by far the weirdest SCP I've ever done. Not just because it involves a sex-focused GoI, but because this all started when someone said, "Pattern Moaners". I am rather pleased with this one, simply because of how inventive I think it is.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/scp-7548 SCP-7548]: **The Stars, The Hopeful**
[[module ListPages name="scp-7548"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Alteration was also detected in the Sun and in all other planets within the solar system, along with their orbiting satellites. Bodies with low or non-existent magnetic fields, such as Mars and the Earth's Moon, were also detected developing their own field, despite not possessing the geological makeup to produce one.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
The remixcon entry I didn't finish in time. As you can see, it's a retelling of [[[SCP-1548]]], with a very different ending. This came to me after I listen to the music for 6999 and 7676 and watching the BBC television show, //The Planets//. I also wanted to push my formatting skills and do a page list, which I think work rather well in the end.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/SCP-8899 SCP-8899]: **There is a Tide**
[[module ListPages name="SCP-8899"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> = //For You, Isis, a hiding, a hint, a whisper, an obscuration, a veil.//
> 
> The Sixth Occult War lasted from 1864 to 1869. A war of several sides and no victor. Only losers. One of the most detrimental conflicts humanity will ever face. But the world will recover. Only this time, it will be different. This time, a line will be drawn. This time, there will be a Veil.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
My first attempt at a K Con. I had this idea in the works for a long time, all starting when i questioned: How one earth did the Veil get put up in the first place? It went through several redos and rewrites, and the formatting was a nightmare, but I am slightly proud of the outcome.

Am I please with the outcome? Partially. I do wish it had got more attention but it was going against a lot of people
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[[/tab]]
[[tab Tales and Other Pages]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/secure-facility-dossier-site-12 Site-12]: **Secure Facility Dossier: Site-12**
[[module ListPages name="secure-facility-dossier-site-12"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Overseen by the Department of History and Archival Department, Site-12's library houses the largest collection of anomalous history within the Foundation and continues to grow.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Site-12 has been in the back of my mind ever since I read Site-44's Dossier. I've always like the idea of a site underground but not like the ones found in America. All concrete and dust. I want one with class. So, I made of with history, with mystery and a lovely library.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/nx-02 Nx-02]: **Annwn**
[[module ListPages name="nx-02"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Currently, due to differences in goals, relations between the Foundation and Arawn ap Carnonos are strained, with the latter revoking all access to Nx-02 from Foundation personnel.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Nx-02 came about after I finished 6916 and War On All Fronts. I decided I wanted to continue expanding on the stories involving Celtic and Irish mythology and fairy folklore. Also, lets expand on why exactly the Fae left their comfy little home.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/history-of-behemoths History of Behemoths]
[[module ListPages name="history-of-behemoths"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> As the Flame began again, Nahash joined in their gesturing and movements. The fires in the shield grew and towered the two, filling the air with several dancing figures of fire, each accompanied by a small, white entity with green eyes. They swarmed around the two figures. The Behemoth and the Flame.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
I am a huge fan of the War On All Fronts Canon. And after reading them again and again, I decided to kind of write an origin story for the Behemoths and the Serpent, and also give a reason why the Serpent became the guardian of the Wanderer's Library and how the Tree actually became a Library in the first place. This also may come into play in my own little series coming soon.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/a-brief-introduction-to-thaumaturgical-engineering A Brief Introduction to Thaumaturgical Engineering]
[[module ListPages name="a-brief-introduction-to-thaumaturgical-engineering"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> "In the anomalous world, Akiva Radiation is also known as Divine Grace, Yǐncáng shéngzi and Sruth. Here, in The Foundation, we use the term Akiva Radiation or, in a rush, just Akiva. What is it? Putting it simply, it's a subatomic particle that gravitates towards and coalesces around matter with thaumaturgical capabilities or properties. Just like a moth to a flame."

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Inspired by all the orientations and thing I've read since I came here. Monologue is a fun way of telling a story I think, as it's kind of up to the listener/reader to figure out the reason of the goings on around the speaker. Allows for a great deal of creative room. Also, I like the works of Terry Pratchett and Joyce Grenfell, who'd often write and perform using monologue. I also wanted to put my own spin on Akiva Radiation as - not to insult anyone - I find the way magic is written in 
some skips and tales to be a bit - overcomplicated. 
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/a-dreaming-giant-s-chair A Dreaming Giant's Chair]
[[module ListPages name="a-dreaming-giant-s-chair"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> And so, from that day onward, Idris was blessed with oneiric union with the Library, and would move through its halls and branches when he dreamt. Through the dreams, he went on to learn and craft, forging new methods in magic and horticulture and paving paths and gardens into the landscape.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
Just a fun little go at a GoI piece, which of course, I based off of a real legend and place.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/anomaly-243-the-neamh-mairbh Anomaly 243 - "The Neamh-Mairbh"]
[[module ListPages name="anomaly-243-the-neamh-mairbh"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> The creatures are believed to be sterile, although this claim has yet to be confirmed by observation. Whilst the creatures haven't been observed breeding, they are capable of performing a theurgic, xenogenetic metamorphosis, in which they endow their anomaly qualities into another individual. How this is achieved is not unknown and requires further research. 

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
My attempt to create a new GOI format for the HMFSCP. Also based on the Irish myth of the Neamh-Mairbh, who are a kind of mixture of vampires and ghouls. I decided to add some Hy-Brasil and Second-Hytoth lore in there for fun. I'm proud of the styling of this article more than anything.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/in-june-i-change-my-tune In June, I Change My Tune.]
[[module ListPages name="in-june-i-change-my-tune"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> The thing that had once been a man, who had once been Terry, who had once had a dog called Bertie, smiled weakly, thinking only of how good it had been. Terry, who'd once been a thing in the back of another mind, felt a shudder of pain and pleasure as their body changed into something more accurate.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
The first proper tale I made. I mean like the ones I used to read from the earlier SCP days. As you can see, I kind of like the switching perspective kind of style of the story. Don't know why. Make me think you can do a lot of things all at once.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/anomaly-306-the-silver-alder Anomaly 306 - "The Silver Alder"]
[[module ListPages name="anomaly-306-the-silver-alder"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> The species are identifiable by their colouration and material properties. The wood of the tree is of a tainted, metallic grey colour, not unlike tarnished silver, whilst its leaves and catkins are pigmented a deep, russet red.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
The use of the HMFSCP format again. This took me a while, mostly because I had to try and mix Broken God, Arthurian Legend, Celtic and Greek Mythology, American History and Victorian science into one article. All of this kind of started because of my love for [[[SCP-2307]]], which I am totally using in the future.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/goc-supplemental-humanoid-guide "Excerpts from PHYSICS Division Field Manual 13: Special Circumstances, Humanoid Threat Entities - Type Blue: Thaumatologist"]
[[module ListPages name="goc-supplemental-humanoid-guide"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> Thaumatologists (Type Blues) have numerous names, including witches, wizards, sorcerers, magicians, miracle workers, and occultists. It doesn't matter what they are called because all inherently do the same thing: utilise thaumaturgy, which many of you may know, is colloquially known as magic

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
One of my favuorite genres of story is Science Fantasy. Combining magic with scientific principles is right up my street. I'm also a huge fan of Hard Fantasy, the concept of writing magic with set boundaries and rules. When I saw that no one had written a page for Type Blues in the GOC page, I jumped at the opportunity.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/experiment-log-2307-a "Experiment Log 2307 A"]
[[module ListPages name="experiment-log-2307-a"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> **The ruler of Celliwig. Descendent of the Mabyn's Arawn of the Deathless. The leader of the Camlann [UNKNOWN WORD. TRANSLATION FAILED.] The high king of the Britons, Arthur Pendragon.**
> 
> Fuck off.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
King Arthur meets Mekhanite lore? Of course. Introducing Merlin? Of course.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/theme:immrama "Immrama Theme"]
[[module ListPages name="theme:immrama"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> A theme created for the use in my hub series.

[*https://scp-wiki.wikidot.com/a-folklorist-approach-to-myth-case-study-01-the-tuatha-de-da "A Folklorist Approach to Myth - Case Study 01: The Tuatha Dé Danann"]
[[module ListPages name="a-folklorist-approach-to-myth-case-study-01-the-tuatha-de-da"]]
[%%created_at%%] [###304529|+%%rating%%##] (##grey|%%comments%% comments##)
[[/module]]

> The Tuatha Dé Danann (derived from Irish Gaelic, meaning "the folk of the goddess Danu"), are a hominid subspecies predominantly inhabiting Nx-03 ("Hy-Brasil"), though some have emigrated to Ireland, the United Kingdom, the USA, Canada or other Nexuses and Free Ports. Identified by their tapered ears and brilliant green and gold irises, their mystical heritage is undeniable.

[[collapsible show="▼ Spoilers!" hide="▲ I warned you!"]]

[[div class="blockquote"]]
King Arthur meets Mekhanite lore? Of course. Introducing Merlin? Of course.
[[/div]]
[[/collapsible]]

[[/tab]]
[[tab Artwork]]

[[/tab]]
[[tab F.A.Q.]]
**Favourite SCP per Series**
* [[[SCP-882|SCP-882]]]: A Machine
* [[[SCP-1981|SCP-1981]]]: "RONALD REAGAN CUT UP WHILE TALKING"
* [[[SCP-2845|SCP-2845]]]: THE DEER
* [[[SCP-3034|SCP-3034]]]: The Counting Station
* [[[SCP-4217|SCP-4217]]]: Contain The Bismarck
* [[[SCP-5514|SCP-5514]]]: The Dragonslayer
* [[[SCP-6999|SCP-6999]]]: Nearer, My God, To Thee - //My Favourite Series//
* [[[SCP-7676|SCP-7676]]]: The Grand Symphony of 1976
* [[[SCP-8007|SCP-8007]]]: THE PYROCLASM PROTOCOL

**Favourite 001 Proposal**
* [[[rounderhouse-proposal|SCP-001]]]: Memento Mori

**Favourite Canon**
* [[[war-on-all-fronts-hub|War On All Fronts]]]

**Favourite Authors**
* [[*user Ethagon]], [[*user stormbreath]], [[*user Dr Leonerd]] and [[*user peppersghost]]

**My Badges For Being A Good Boy**

[[include component:sybadge code=tsf]]

[[include component:sybadge code=pdp]]
[[/=]]

[[/tab]]
[[/tabview]]
@@ @@
[[div class="document"]]
Shwmae.

Real me talking here. The real [[*user arthcymro]]. You can refer to me as Arth.

Been here since Nov 2020, but started making monsters and myths in 2022. ###304529|//**Note to newbies, start small.**//## You can thank **[*https://www.youtube.com/c/TheExploringSeries The Exploring Series]** for my presents here. What do I like to write about? Hmmmmm. Not really sure. I guess I prefer the lighter side of things. No world-ending abominations or metaphysical nonsense. I more about the history and the adventures, with maybe some tears shed here and there.

What do I do outside of this?
@@ @@
...
@@ @@
None of your business.

Noswaith dda.
[[/div]]
@@ @@

author: arthcymro
